title: Drawing, "Sepulchral monument for poet Orsini of Rome", after 1795
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite, on paper
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Giovanni Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description:
Three steps lead to a pedestal flanked by two standing women who hold censers. Two putti hold festoons on the pedestal.

Inscription:
GIACE.QUI.IL.LIRICO/ POETA.CHE.SCRISSE/ E.DISSE.IN.ARCHADIA/ BENISSIMO.

Two strange animals carry a cinerary box with he inscription "ORSINI.R(oma)no". In landscape. Bordered by ink and blue paper stripes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sepulchral monument for poet Orsini of Rome", after 1795.
after 1795. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite, on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-275.
